document.heading: Underage Drinking Temporary Amendment Act of 1993

history.narrative: Law 10-12, the “Underage Drinking Temporary Amendment Act of 1993,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-261. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 4, 1993, and June 1, 1993, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 16, 1993, it was assigned Act No. 10-40 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-12 became effective on September 11, 1993.
